title: Quiz 6: Home and Community Based Care (HCBC)
topicName: HIV, AIDS and STIs Comprehensive Teaching Manual
description: Assess knowledge on HCBC definitions, rationale, stakeholder roles, and components.

questions.question: What is the definition of Home Based Care?

options.text: Care provided solely in the hospital
Care extended from the health facility to the patient's home
Care provided by traditional healers only

questions.explanation: HCBC is care extended from the hospital to the home via family/community participation in collaboration with health workers.
questions.hint: It connects the facility to the home.

questions.question: Which of the following are objectives of HCBC? (Select all that apply)

options.text: To empower the family and community

questions.explanation: HCBC aims to continue care, empower communities, and reduce stigma, not to replace hospitals entirely.

questions.question: Match the stakeholder to their primary role in HCBC:

pairs.right: Daily care giving and emotional support

questions.explanation: Facilities diagnose; Families care; Government regulates; Communities support.
questions.hint: Who sets the rules? Who does the daily work?

questions.question: In HCBC, the health care worker is responsible for staying with the patient 24/7.
questions.explanation: The family/caregiver provides daily care. The health worker educates, guides, and follows up.
questions.hint: Think about who lives with the patient.

questions.question: Care for patients with terminal diseases to reduce pain and suffering is called ___BLANK___ care.
questions.explanation: Palliative care focuses on comfort and quality of life for the terminally ill.

questions.question: What are the components of Home Based Care? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: HCBC includes clinical, nursing, counseling, and social support. Surgery is a hospital procedure.

questions.question: Name one challenge of community mobilization listed in the manual.
questions.explanation: Challenges include time/energy demands, rigid expectations, pre-determined lifespans, and incomplete participation.
questions.hint: Think about the effort required from volunteers.

questions.question: Who is the primary provider of care if the patient is not very sick?
questions.explanation: Ideally, the patient provides self-care if they are able.

questions.question: One rationale for HCBC is to increase the congestion in health facilities.
questions.explanation: Rationale includes REDUCING congestion and easing demand on health facilities.
questions.hint: HCBC is meant to decongest hospitals.

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of a 'mobilized community'?

options.text: They wait for the government to solve all problems
They are aware of their vulnerability and take action
They deny the existence of HIV
They exclude PLWHA from decision making

questions.explanation: A mobilized community is aware, motivated, knowledgeable, and takes action using its own resources.
